name: Business Talent Group
slogan: Marketplace that connects independent consultants with top companies

jobs.title: Client Development Associate
jobs.description:
Business Talent Group (BTG) is the leading marketplace that connects independent management consultants, subject matter experts, and executives with top companies to solve their biggest business problems. BTG provides just the right on-demand talent needed—on-site or remote, part-time or full-time, individuals or teams, anywhere in the world.

 

That’s why more than 40% of the F100 trust BTG to curate, vet, and deliver talent who fuel growth, innovation, and performance improvement. Our commitment to project success has earned us a 99% fill rate on all talent requests and a 97% repeat rate among top global companies.

 

We pride ourselves on having developed a fast-paced, fun and dynamic culture. We encourage all of our employees to learn and grow personally and professionally so they can assume greater responsibilities and advance their careers.

 

Role/ Responsibilities:

We are seeking a confident and self-motivated individual(s) to join our growing client development team in West Lost Angeles, New York, or Chicago. We are looking for innovative individuals, who are competitive yet can be part of a team, goal oriented, love to learn and have an entrepreneurial spirit.

 

As an Associate, you will support our Client Development team.  This team is responsible for developing new corporate clients and going to market with a fresh, exciting service. In this entry-level sales position, Associates will get exposure to a broad base of companies with diverse needs.   You will learn something new about business every day and get to interact with some of the most experienced minds in business. Extensive training will be provided.

 

Qualifications:

A desire to start a career in sales and advance within the company
Excellent time management and organizational skills
Confidence speaking with senior executives
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
Enthusiasm for an entrepreneurial work environment
The ability to work both independently and as a team
2:1 (or equivalent) degree from a leading university
 

Compensation:

Competitive base salary
Bonus opportunities
Comprehensive Benefits

jobs.title: Client Success Associate
jobs.description:
BTG is seeking a recent graduate (6 months to 1.5 years of experience) to serve as an associate on our Client Success (CS) team. CS Associates will work with the team that delivers on-demand solutions to solve client needs on a project-by-project basis. The ideal candidate is passionate about business, possesses a customer success orientation, and thrives in a fast-paced environment. The associate will be based in our London office.

As part of our team you will:
•	Support all aspects of our on-demand consulting projects including proposal drafting, consultant identification, contracting, project close, and project success  
•	Partner with internal cross-functional teams, including sales, finance, and legal, to support the Client Success processes
•	Maintain and help grow positive relationships with clients and consultants throughout the lifetime of the project
•	Gain exposure to the consulting world by working on a wide variety of business industries and functional areas  
•	Work closely with formerly trained consultants with MBAs from leading universities, who will function as your partner on a portfolio of projects

Qualifications:
•	Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
•	Professional phone presence; comfortable speaking with senior executives across various corporations/industries 
•	Demonstrated attention to detail
•	Team player, able to contribute to the overall goals of a team
•	Self-starter/entrepreneurial nature with high intellectual curiosity
•	Willingness to be flexible and work on a variety of projects at once in a fast-paced environment
•	Proven time management and organizational skills; ability to juggle multiple projects with competing deadlines 
•	BA/BS degree from a leading university with a minimum 3.0 GPA; interest in business preferred
•	Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite

Compensation:
•	Competitive base salary and educational stipend
•	Bonus opportunities
